entry.def: If you refer to the replacement of one thing by another, you mean that the second thing takes the place of the first.

example.ex: ...the replacement of damaged or lost books.
example.tran: 受损或丢失图书的更换或补充

entry.tran: 替补(成员或队员)；接替者
entry.def: Someone who takes someone else's place in an organization, government, or team can be referred to as their replacement .

example.ex: Taylor has nominated Adams as his replacement...
example.tran: 泰勒提名亚当斯接替他。

example.ex: The 18-year-old made his debut last week as a replacement for the injured Gordon Durie.
example.tran: 这个18岁选手作为受伤的戈登·迪里的替补在上周首次出场。

means.word_mean: 1. an event in which one thing is substituted for another;

sentences.sentence: "the replacement of lost blood by a transfusion of donor blood"

means.word_mean: 2. the act of furnishing an equivalent person or thing in the place of another;

sentences.sentence: "replacing the star will not be easy"

means.word_mean: 3. someone who takes the place of another person
4. a person or thing that takes or can take the place of another
5. filling again by supplying what has been used up
6. a person who follows next in order;

stems_affixes.value_cn: 移置, 转移, 取代, 置换
stems_affixes.word_buile: displace取代,替换+ment表名词→n.移置, 转移, 取代, 置换
fire火+place放,地方→生火的地方→壁炉

stems_affixes.value_cn: 地方, 地点, 位置
stems_affixes.word_buile: place放,地方→n.地方, 地点, 位置 v.放置

stems_affixes.value_cn: 取代,替换,替换物,代替物
stems_affixes.word_buile: replace代替+ment表名词→n.取代,替换,替换物,代替物
dis去掉+place放,地方→把放的东西去掉
place放,地方→n.地方, 地点, 位置 v.放置

stems_affixes.value_cn: 取代,替换,代替,把……放回原处
stems_affixes.word_buile: re重新+place放,地方→重新放→复职,引申为"代替"

Sentence.sentence: A baby-sitter is no replacement for a mother.
The woman needs a temporary replacement for her assistant.
There is no replacement for the handle.

sentences.en: The bike is in need of replacement.

means.word_mean: 替换的人[物],（尤指工作中的）接替者，替代者

sentences.en: As Jack is ill, we have to get a replacement for him.
sentences.cn: 杰克生病了, 我们必须找一个人代替他。
